meanings.definition: A person who engages in wrestling or hand-to-hand combat.
meanings.sent1: The young grapplers practiced their moves in the gym.
meanings.sent2: The professional grapplers put on an exciting show for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The two grapplers jokingly challenged each other to a friendly match.
meanings.sent4: In the ring, the grapplers were like fierce lions fighting for dominance.
meanings.sent5: The image of the grapplers locked in combat was etched in the spectators' minds.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for gripping or holding onto something.
meanings.sent1: The rock climber used special grapplers to ascend the steep cliff.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic reached for the grapplers to tighten the bolts securely.
meanings.sent3: The lost hiker fashioned a makeshift grappler from a sturdy branch.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a mental grappler, holding onto his thoughts long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The grappler clung tightly to the metal beam, preventing any accidents.

meanings.definition: A type of tire with deep treads for better traction on rough terrain.
meanings.sent1: The off-road vehicle was equipped with heavy-duty grapplers for the muddy track.
meanings.sent2: The farmer chose grapplers for his tractor to navigate the rugged fields.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous group decided to go off-roading with their new grapplers.
meanings.sent4: The grapplers on the tires dug deep into the snow, ensuring a safe journey.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the grapplers gripping the gravel road echoed through the valley.
